casebody.data:
HAY FOUNDRY & IRON WORKS, Plaintiff, v. BUTTERWORTH-JUDSON CORPORATION, Defendant, and United States, Appellant. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. May 18, 1925.) No. 375. Rushmore, Bisbee & Stern, of New York City (Eldon Bisbee and Bertram F. Shipman, both of New York City, of counsel), for receivers. Emory R. Buckner, U. S. Atty., of New York City, Alexander Holtzoff, Sp. Asst. Atty. Gen., and Robert E. Manley and Charles L. Sylvester, Asst. U. S. Attys., both of New York City, for petitioner appellant.

Before ROGERS, HOUGH, and HAND, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree affirmed, on the decision of this court in Equitable Trust Co. v. Connecticut Brass & Manufacturing Corporation, 290 F. 712.
